fields.Title: JAM / MONUMENT REFLECTION
fields.Description: After the Tribunal, Harry reflects on the re-conceptualization of the horseback monument by Idiot Doom Spiral. (ULTRALIBERAL DREAM QUEST)

fields.Dialogue Text: Why dwell on dead tissue? *Your* body survived the battle. *Your* muscles proved the mightier. Celebrate the living instead.

fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe it's an honest portrait of who I am and what I've done.

fields.Dialogue Text: "100% worth it. I'd do it all over again -- but this time with more *profit*."

fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, let's get back to making money.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods in hopes of humouring you t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He nods in hopes of humouring you then closes his eyes for half a beat. When he opens them, it's clear he has something to say to you...

fields.Title: You: ""About what?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "About what?"

fields.Title: You: ""Even *I'm* not sure what that's su..."

fields.Dialogue Text: "About this... pursuit of wealth... pursuit of recognition." He looks up, trying to find a name for your actions.

fields.Title: Endurance: "No, you should own up to it, claim..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, you should own up to it, claim it as *yours*. Forget about the haters.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Tax? What tax? We're in Revachol."..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Tax? What tax? We're in Revachol." He looks around, as if looking for hidden taxation, then shakes his head.

fields.Title: Logic: "Has The End not already come? Stone..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Has The End not already come? Stones were wetted, bloods were coughed, the locals cast under greater shadow. Is this not inappropriate when tribute should instead be placed?

fields.Title: Composure: "Putting on a brave face and partyin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Putting on a brave face and partying as hard as possible is the best way to get through tough times.

fields.Title: You: "Yes, let's get back to making money..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, let's get back to making money.

fields.Title: fiasco or not

fields.Dialogue Text: "The free market demands it."

fields.Dialogue Text: Honest. Maybe even *too* honest... Didn't we talk about giving back to the community?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. The roundabout is quiet, a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He nods. The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the brilliant sunlight. The tickets remain true to their duty -- except for a few that have come unstuck, now assigned to brushing dirt from the asphalt below...
fields.Alternate1: He nods. The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the sodium lights. The tickets remain true to their duty, ready for the night shift -- except for a few that have come unstuck, now assigned to brushing dirt from the asphalt below...
fields.Alternate2: He nods. The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so in the rain. The sodden tickets remain true to their duty against the storm -- except for a few that lie face down below, honourably drowned in a puddle...
fields.Alternate3: He nods. The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so in the snow. The tickets remain true to their duty, like a crowd of commuters huddled for warmth -- except for a few that have come unstuck, now assigned to raking the drifts below...

fields.Dialogue Text: "Wait, I want to talk to Idiot Doom Spiral first."

Horseback Monument: "Petal wreaths cluster the monument..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Petal wreaths cluster the monument in gloves of colour. Nectar scents the air and calls attention to the blossom. Atop it all sits a figure, veiled and black, sorrowful due to an unknown loss.

fields.Title: You: "(Perform the Stations of the Breath..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Perform the Stations of the Breath.)

fields.Title: Savoir Faire: "Maybe... But we still have a long w..."

fields.Title: You: ""Okay, let me have one more look at..."

fields.Dialogue Text: He nods. The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the brilliant sunlight. The penumbral griever is a silhouette against the bright sky, the flowers lifting him in requiem starting to wilt...
fields.Alternate1: He nods. The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the sodium lights. Darkness completely engulfs the penumbral griever. The flowers lifting him in requiem are starting to wilt...
fields.Alternate2: He nods. The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so in the rain. Drops fall like tears down the veil of the penumbral griever, while a few fallen petals drift like funerary boats downstream, weeping into drains...
fields.Alternate3: He nods. The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so in the snow. The penumbral griever cuts black his misery against the white weather. The flowers lifting him in requiem are starting to wilt in the cold...

fields.Title: You: ""I really don't need to be judged l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I really don't need to be judged like this, especially after the amount of tax I've paid."

fields.Title: Savoir Faire: "Still keeping the superstar dream a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Still keeping the superstar dream alive...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You managed to gather quite a fort..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You managed to gather quite a fortune, kicked off by underpaying a young artist..."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Underpaying? But you paid the highe..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Underpaying? But you paid the highest possible price!

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "'Gone rogue'? No, Idiot Doom Spiral..."
fields.Dialogue Text: 'Gone rogue'? No, Idiot Doom Spiral has finally achieved something *remarkable*.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah yes. Spoken like a true busines..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ah yes. Spoken like a true businessman." He smiles gently.

fields.Title: You: ""Actually, I'd prefer silence.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Actually, I'd prefer silence."

fields.Title: Empathy: "Demands *what*? Endless reconceptua..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Demands *what*? Endless reconceptualization? The lives we lost? The charade?

fields.Title: You: ""Hey, it's the system. I did my bes..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hey, it's the system. I did my best to support artists, employ people, give back to the community."
fields.Alternate1: "Hey, it's the system. I did my best to support artists, employ people, give back to the community. Even told Idiot Doom Spiral to stop drinking."

fields.Title: You: ""Makes you proud to be part of the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Makes you proud to be part of the RCM."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think we have time for tha..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't think we have time for that. And even if we did, I doubt he's around anymore. Everyone's left."

fields.Title: Empathy: "And don't forget about the lying..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And don't forget about the lying...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And was it all worth it?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "And was it all worth it?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright, shall we? We still have s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Alright, shall we? We still have some things left to do before we can go home."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Who?" The lieutenant meets your ey..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who?" The lieutenant meets your eyes with a questioning glance -- then looks up again.

fields.Title: Empathy: "People are trying to mourn and all..."
fields.Dialogue Text: People are trying to mourn and all they can hear are those little tickets flapping in their ears.

fields.Title: next hub
Rhetoric: "You *had to* pay her so little, oth..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You *had to* pay her so little, otherwise you wouldn't have made any profit -- and if you don't make a profit, you don't have money to invest!

fields.Title: Horseback Monument: "Wind blows hard enough to chip away..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wind blows hard enough to chip away at the edges of the paint. The bright rebellion is already starting to dull...

fields.Title: Half Light: "Look -- up there! It is he who sire..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look -- up there! It is he who sirens. Syntagmatarchis Trypa! Here, upon us, to warn of the mangy jowls of The Gloaming.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Such busy fingers. Each ticket writ..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Such busy fingers. Each ticket written by hand, ripped from the pad, then pressed against the metal until stuck.

fields.Title: Empathy: "And don't forget about the way you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And don't forget about the way you conned an honest pawnshop owner.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A fitting testament to the lives l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A fitting testament to the lives lost," the lieutenant says as he turns toward the plaza. He holds one hand against his chest, the other is outstretched -- palm flat to the air.
